titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3350) to authorize health insurance issuers to continue to offer for sale current individual health insurance coverage in satisfaction of the minimum essential health insurance coverage requirement, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-265, by Mr. Burgess.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3350 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 73.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 413.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 193 (Roll no. 583).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 189 (Roll no. 584).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/14/2013--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3350) to authorize health insurance issuers to continue to offer for sale current individual health insurance coverage in satisfaction of the minimum essential health insurance coverage requirement.
